text: I am watching closely if @eth_classic overtakes @ethereum it would be a strong demonstration that decentralization and immutable quality of the blockchain really matters.

It's an impressive number too though imo some of the centralized stablecoins reflect neither the trust/authority-minimizing decentralization values of ethereum nor traditional values of good centralized governance so I prefer not to emphasize them
> I wonder what Ethereum will have in 2023 which we do not have now Bitcoin maximalists complaining that we do not yet have polynomial commitment based witness compression on mainnet.

Things Ethereum has in 2020 that it did not in 2017: * Uniswap * http://Tornado.cash * Status * MakerDAO * ZK Rollups (eg. Loopring), >2k TPS capacity * PoS testnets * Uncle rates < 10% with 10m gas blocks * Gitcoin grants Move the goalposts faster, or else we'll catch up!

Gitcoin grants quadratic funding is not just for funds allocation, it's also a great signaling tool! For the last few rounds, going to https://gitcoin.co/grants/?sort_option=-clr_prediction_curve__0__1&category= (sort by top match) has led me to discover a lot of really cool Ethereum projects I previously did not know about.

This is important groundwork by @gballet and co in making Ethereum #stateless friendly, and at the same time creating an opportunity to considerably simplify the protocol. Look forward to more excellent hard work and results from 1.x devs in the months to come.

The ability to use applications based on ethereum, including makerdao, http://tornado.cash, smart contract wallets, prediction markets, status....? Also ETH is a great cryptocurrency in its own right.

We should also be building DEX bridges between ethereum and other crypto ecosystems. I've talked to @zooko about this re Zcash, though I think we can both work harder to translate the talk into action. Would love to see more.
I don't think I did any moderation actions during the DAO situation..... and I didn't direct others to do any either.
This technique is used in ethereum to scan for logs relevant to a particular application more quickly! Love seeing compsci bleed over into totally-not-computery fields.
Ethereum has not adopted trusted setup based crypto at protocol layer.

Ethereum contract code has a lot of duplication, some total, some partial, and the protocol does a terrible job of pricing in the lower load that duplicate code has to clients in the gas schedule. DELEGATECALL improved this somewhat but it's still very far from enough.
You should make a twitter poll. After all, ethereum's official governance mechanism *is* proof of social media. If you make a poll then we are bound by holy law to follow the result.

Do you speak another language or know someone who does? If you're stuck inside and want to learn more about Ethereum, you could read and help translate #MasteringEthereum. It's open source! Learn more http://bit.ly/3cTNjBn

No, Bitcoin as a store of value isn’t dead just because it had a super shitty day. No, Ethereum and defi aren’t dead just because they had a super shitty day. In the coming months the world will see what anti-fragile means.

New episode with @alpackaP is now live! We discuss his views of the Asian crypto markets, how he sees certain market narratives playing out, whether Ethereum (ETH) is money, and where Alex will be focused on investing in the coming 3-5 years. Enjoy!

Apparently ethereum transactions were not being executed due to network congestion, thus liquidation auctions for MakerDAO weren't being executed, thus someone was able to step in as the only bidder to "buy" $8,000,000 for $0. https://medium.com/@whiterabbit_hq/black-thursday-for-makerdao-8-32-million-was-liquidated-for-0-dai-36b83cac56b6

Here is my "I Told You So" of the week! Anyone who believes in the Stupid of Centralized lending service @MakerDAO #MakerDAO w/ all the disadvantages of #Blockchain w/ 0 advantages & was promoting it to others DESERVES to lose all their Money! #Ethereum #ETH

What will happen when #Ethereum switches to PoS? What will that look like? I asked Mrinal Manohar CEO and Cofounder @meetCasperLabs on http://UntoldStories.com We talk PoS vs PoW, layer 1 vs layer 2 solutions, energy efficiency and more. Sponsors: @CryptoTaxFixer & @bitpanda
